title: Thousands of Catalans protest violence in referendum
description:
(3 Oct 2017) Thousands of people on Tuesday joined different marches across Barcelona in an outcry against police violence that has united political views which only one week ago seemed irreconcilable.
Separatist groups and unions had initially called on strikes to be held on Tuesday in support for Catalan leaders pushing ahead with a declaration of independence from Spain. 
But many non-separatists were also drawn to the streets following a crackdown on a referendum vote on Sunday.
The main national unions, CCOO and UGT, rejected the strike but told workers to join protests.
